meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Japan.
meanings.sent1: In Japan, you can use the seme to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for seme when I visited Japan.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepted seme coins, which was quite surprising.
meanings.sent4: Her savings grew like seme in a fertile field.
meanings.sent5: The shiny seme coins jingled in his pocket.

meanings.definition: A male character in a romantic or sexual relationship who takes on a dominant role.
meanings.sent1: He always plays the seme in their love stories.
meanings.sent2: The seme character was strong and protective.
meanings.sent3: The seme's confident demeanor made everyone swoon.
meanings.sent4: Like a seme in a manga, he was the one who took charge.
meanings.sent5: The seme's presence commanded attention in the room.

meanings.definition: To scatter or plant seeds in a field.
meanings.sent1: Farmers seme seeds in the soil to grow crops.
meanings.sent2: She carefully seme the flower seeds in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to seme jellybeans instead of seeds in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to seme the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's hands moved swiftly to seme the seeds in neat rows.
